sentences.en: A momentary hush; the orchestra leader varies his rhythm obligingly for her.
sentences.cn: 片刻的寂静, 乐队指挥殷勤地为她改变了拍子.
愤怒代替了一时的恐惧.

sentences.en: Ashamed of his momentary pique , Laurie squeezed the kind little hand.
sentences.cn: 劳丽握住那只善意的小手,对于自己心血来潮的牢骚感到很羞愧.

sentences.en: He said, " Defeat is a momentary thing. "
sentences.cn: 他说: “ 失败是一件暂时的事情. ”
他心里一阵惊慌,浑身不自在起来.

sentences.en: I caught a momentary glimpse of them.
In display, a momentary distortion in a picture.
sentences.cn: 显示图象的一种瞬时变形.

sentences.en: It was only a momentary glance, full of contempt and dislike.
sentences.cn: 这只不过是短暂的一瞥, 充满了轻蔑和憎恶.

sentences.en: The momentary relief was followed by worse suffering.
sentences.cn: 短暂的缓解之后接着是更为剧烈的痛苦.

sentences.en: The resistance to him was momentary.
sentences.cn: 对他来说所受到的抵抗转瞬即逝.

sentences.en: There was a momentary silence , profound as what should follow the utterance of oracles.
sentences.cn: 那一刹那的静穆,如同宣告了神谕之后一般深沉.

sentences.en: We are in momentary expectation of the arrival of you.
sentences.cn: 我们无时无刻不在盼望你的到来.
我们为随时可能遭到攻击而提心吊胆.

trans.tran_cn: 短暂的，瞬间的，随时会发生的，时时刻刻的
trans.tran_en: continuing for a very short time
